Constructor Detail

CA

public CA()
Zero Argument Constructor. Initialises the member variables for the CellularAutomata and the flags that control how the CA should be calculated and displayed

Method Detail

breed

public java.util.Vector breed(java.util.Vector parent)
Given a parent generation caluclate the child generation.

Parameters:
parent - describing the state of the parent generation.
Returns:
Return a Vector containing the next generation of the CA.

generateAutomata

public void generateAutomata()
Controls the flow of execution: (1) breed next generation, then (2) display next generation

init

public void init()
Initialise the seed generation.

loop

public void loop()
Control the looping behaviour of the program so that we can calculate a fixed number of generation or otherwise loop indefinitely.

displayOnConsole

public void displayOnConsole(java.util.Enumeration e)
Display the current generation on the console. Console output is only representative and behaviour could be platform specific. If you want to work with the generated CA then you should output to a file or database (but it does produce pretty patterns ).

Parameters:
e - An enumeration encapsulating the CA generation to display.

printGeneration

public void printGeneration(java.util.Enumeration e)
Print the current generation. Various output methods are available such as (1) console output, (2) file output, (3) database output.

Parameters:
e - (Required) An enumeration of Cells

printInfo

public void printInfo()
Display a header describing the CA Pattern and initial seed Generation.
